attributes.action: Force all meat packaging to use images of slaughterhouses to deglamourise meat
attributes.background: Packets of cigarettes after having adopted grotesque images of the effects of smoking in 2008 have reduced the number of smokers significantly in the UK. I am calling on the government to adopt a similar scheme with meat packaging in order to warn people about what they are eating.
attributes.additional_details: Pictures would be stark to illustrate the appalling conditions that animals live in; the effects on health of meat-eating; and the environmental toll that raising animals for meat has.

attributes.action: I believe that it should be mandatory for ALL lunch breaks to be paid.
attributes.background: As of right now, when working on the minimum wage, the employee will lose either £36.90 or £39.15 each week, depending on age group. This is roughly £147.60 or £156.60 lost each month. In my opinion, this is outrageous; ultimately feeling like being punished for needing to eat and rest.

attributes.action: Strip abusive parents of parental rights
attributes.background: Many parents are in impossible situations and have to meet face-to-face with an abuser who has parental rights. As soon as a parent is accused of such a thing, contact should be supervised and if convicted they should lose parental rights.
attributes.additional_details: I just want justice for all parents who have been abused mentally or physically, to give them chance to live.

attributes.action: Ban Smart Meters
attributes.background: There have been concerns about their effect on people’s health, along with the way that they could invade your privacy, and in the end they cost way more compared to an old type of meter.

attributes.action: Improve the number and quality of care homes
attributes.background: Many children in care experience multiple placements, in some cases going to 8 or more different care homes. This is because care homes either shut down or get too full, so a large number of children in care have nowhere to go and end up on the streets, increasing child poverty numbers.

attributes.action: Hold a general election within the next 2 years
attributes.background: We are in the middle of the Brexit process and the government has made no progress at all so far, when we’re about to leave the EU in March next year.  This literally shows that this government is too weak to govern the country and to come to an agreement on terms.
attributes.additional_details: Also, some council elections will be in May 2022, which means the General Election will clash with the council elections and we’re supposed to have one election within this five year timeframe, not more than one.

attributes.action: Employers should pay for Break Time
attributes.background: All employers should pay for Break Time at work for minimum wages employees

attributes.action: Full Public Investigation into all Unresolved Complaints of NHS Medical Errors
attributes.background: For over 40 yrs, the system has failed to protect patients who have suffered medical accidents/errors under the NHS. A toxic culture has prevailed within the NHS of closing ranks to cover up complaints. We need a new body to investigate all unresolved complaints and the misuse of powers/public money
attributes.additional_details: Given the gravity of scale of covering up by the NHS & lack of action taken by complaint bodies & those in Government, this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate all complaints. In order to avoid harm to patients the government need to carry out an investigation across the UK to identify the systemic failure across the NHS & avoid future harm to patients. It must include victims left with ongoing health problems/disabilities & families who have lost a loved one since 1980

attributes.action: Lower the age of consent to 14 or 15
attributes.background: I believe that people hit puberty at about 12. At 14-15, people are still going through puberty but I believe that they are also mature enough to give consent.
attributes.additional_details: Underage sex/pregnancy is a big issue. Moving the age of consent down, while still keeping it at an age where people are old enough to give consent, would reduce underage sex.

attributes.action: Recall of UK ambassador to the US in protest about detaining children in cages.
attributes.background: The United States government has implemented a policy on 06/04/2018 to separate and detain children of asylum seekers entering the US. This is an illegal and inhuman act. By withdrawing (recalling) the UK's ambassador to the US this send a strong an clear message that this is not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Since June 2018 US Customs and Border Portection have been forcibly removing children from their parents, people claiming asylum. These children have and are being detained in centres little more than cages and tented cities. The children are numbered and tagged. The US government has now opened 'Tender Age Shelters' to house babies and infants. See:

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/rachel-maddow-cries-tender-age-shelters-video-us-migrant-children-separated-parents-a8407436.html

attributes.action: Cap Tax Avoidance - Introduce 1% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: It is not unreasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated fairly and equally under the tax legislation.  The minimum corporation tax rate based on turnover should be the mechanism to ensure that this happens.
attributes.additional_details:
The minimum corporation tax can be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.   The new tax could easily be extended in the future to include all cypto-currency transactions to ensure the tax compliance.

On average, the FTSE 100 companies’ corporation tax expense to turnover has gone from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years and companies like eBay pay even less with 0.2% of their turnover going to the UK Tax-man!

attributes.action: Introduce retail transaction tax and abolish retailers’ business rates
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  This disproportionate cost is contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% retail business rate tax on each sales transaction value rather than property space would be a fairer arrangement and would be directly linked to the business’s success rather than the cause of its failure. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place. The credit card holder’s physical location (in-store) or credit card address (online) are readily available for re-allocation to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Tax breaks for public houses that ONLY serve beverages manufactured in the UK.
attributes.background: To aid against the loss of public houses across the UK, many of which are central to a community. Also providing a boost to UK brewers/manufacturing. And creating more jobs in this sector.

attributes.action: Adopt the STV voting system for a more representative government.
attributes.background: Our current FPTP voting system is extremely flawed. The system has been in use for so long that, just like the USA, we are stuck in a two-party system that we will never be able to break out of.
attributes.additional_details:
Let’s imagine a new country adopts the system and holds the first election. The results are-
Blue- 27% of votes 
Green-32% of votes
Red-21% of votes
Yellow-20% of votes.
Green party wins with only 32% of the country’s representatives but is elected PM (68% of the country is unrepresented).
This is the system we have in the UK. 
I don’t have enough characters left to explain the benefits of STV, but please use these videos to learn-
https://youtu.be/P38Y4VG1Ibo
https://youtu.be/l8XOZJkozfI

attributes.action: Change GCSE's Grades From 9-1 to 1-9
attributes.background: Most people get confused with the new GCSE's grading system and personally i do not like it.

attributes.action: Ban Govt ministers of places where homosexuality is illegal owning UK companies
attributes.background: In many countries, homosexuality is still considered a crime. This is in direct contrast to the UK, where same-sex sexual activity has been legal since 1967. Government Ministers in countries where homosexuality is still illegal should be banned from owning UK based companies.
attributes.additional_details: Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan is currently the Deputy Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, where same-sex sexual activity is illegal. He also owns City Football Group, which Manchester City FC is part of. Football is the national sport of the UK, yet the owner of the Premier League champions is Deputy Prime Minister of a country where homosexuality is illegal. If LGBT equality is to be achieved, Government Ministers from these countries cannot be permitted to own UK-based companies.

attributes.action: Reform the police complaints system
attributes.background: For over 50 years, the system has failed to protect Black/Asian people from feeling targeted and racially profiled by the police. We need a new body to investigate police misuse of powers, recommend that individual officers be prosecuted or sacked and recommend ways to reform the police.
attributes.additional_details:
This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call witnesses and summon documents and records. Most importantly, it must include representatives of victims of police misconduct to ensure it has the confidence of every individual in society. People should be protected regardless of colour or background.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/207561
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/166709

attributes.action: Allow all shops (regardless of size) to open for only 6 hours on a Sunday.
attributes.background: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for up to any 6 consecutive hours on a Sunday, because Sunday is a special day for families to get together. To protect the high street, the government should also ban home deliveries for online shopping on a Sunday.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for any 6 hours on Sundays and the government should force all shops (regardless of size) to close on Easter Sunday and on Christmas Day when it falls on a Sunday. The only exceptions should be petrol stations that only sell fuel, airport shops (past security), pharmacies and shops on seagoing ships.

attributes.action: Legalise plural marriage.
attributes.background: The people will be free to decide for themselves how many people they can marry.
attributes.additional_details: The government has no reason to involve itself in the love life of its citizens.

attributes.action: Lower the retirement age for frontline road and call takers ambulance staff
attributes.background: 65 is the retirement age for ambulance staff. This type of work is too much at this age. Carrying patients, 12 hour shifts, night shifts and the type of jobs we see. We have a high mortality rate. We need to be brought in line with fire staff and police staff.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that ambulance staff have a mortality rate of 2 years post retirement. At a time when our staff should be relaxing after caring so much for so many years many are being taken from us too early. Reduce the retirement age

attributes.action: Replace the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation
attributes.background: I believe that the ombudsman service just has not got the ability to handle complaints about financial services. There is evidence in the media and on online review services like trustpilot.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to consider replacing the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation that is not funded by, or affiliated with, the banks and other financial services.

attributes.action: Introduce a (5%) Voluntary Tax where people can allocate as they choose
attributes.background: There is a lot of shouting about the lack of funds here and there. NHS, education, police and soforth. But no-one especially wants a tax raise, especially when their funds are tight. What this idea is a voluntary tax, but one where a person can specifically choose where that tax goes.
attributes.additional_details:
The way it would work it would be something that people can opt-in, or opt-out. Opt-in of a voluntary tax, and they would then pick a choice where they want that payment of tax to be allocated. For example.
>NHS >Education >Roads >Railways >Military etc.

attributes.action: Allow the purchase of alcohol between 8am and 11pm
attributes.background: The purchase of alcohol should be allowed between 8am and 11pm as the times the law describe are just too late. I have personal relations with close friends who are heavily reliant on alcohol and need it for medicinal reasons but have to endure a long mornings and nights in pain.
attributes.additional_details: It is understood the reasons for the times that are set but i honestly feel the reasons behind this law have now become mostly irrelevant. It is unfair on these people who have to suffer most mornings and nights because of this. It is hard seeing close ones in these situations.

attributes.action: Urge the Commonwealth to suspend Pakistan’s membership.
attributes.background: The former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, has not been given a fair trial by the Supreme Court of Pakistan. His life and political career may be in danger.
attributes.additional_details:
The Supreme Court of Pakistan has taken away the right from Nawaz Sharif to contest the next general elections in Pakistan. He has also been disqualified from Prime Ministership. Nawaz Sharif is a target of the Pakistan Army and Supreme Court of Pakistan. 
 
The UK Government should urge the Commonwealth Ministerial Action Group to suspend Pakistan’s Commonwealth membership, until they give fair trial and right to contest election to Nawaz Sharif.

attributes.action: Create a national safeguarding database.
attributes.background: Too many safeguarding cases go under the radar and have unknown outcomes.  As the way things stand now; disclosures are made and followed up. If the parents are ‘caught’ they sometimes leave the setting/more to a new one or if more serious issue/move out of the area or can be lying and deceptive.
attributes.additional_details: To prevent this from happening there would be a national safeguarding and child protection database. This would have any safeguarding, child protection cases uploaded so that every local authority and council could see the case files and would be flagged up as soon as the family move in to the area. All professionals involved in the case would have access to the database to upload their case notes.

attributes.action: The Government Must Cut Waiting Times For Children’s Mental Health Services
attributes.background: We call on the government to tackle the mental health epidemic at the root, and fast - to do this it needs to cut waiting times for children (5-16 years old), shortening its timeline to introduce maximum waiting times by 2022-23. If not, our country will lose countless young lives in the meantime.
attributes.additional_details: On May 9 two committees of MPs published a report saying the government's plans will take too long to come into effect and will ‘fail a generation’. On average, a child waits a decade from the moment they suffer their first symptom of poor mental health to receiving treatment. At such a crucial stage in children's development, mental health issues should be treated as a matter of urgency. Diagnosing and treating issues early will help deal with problems before they develop into something worse.

attributes.action: To make it illegal to walk any Dog in temperatures above 70 degrees Fahrenheit
attributes.background: Just being left outside without shade or exercise on a hot day can kill your dog! Avoid High Temperatures & Direct Sunlight anything over 70 degrees your dog is at risk from heat exhaustion. Dogs have fur and can’t sweat.  Dogs can only expel heat through their feet and by panting.

attributes.action: Provide testing strips to all type 2 diabetics
attributes.background: Type 2 diabetics need to check blood sugar regardless of what medication they take or if diet controlled.

attributes.action: Remove swimming from the English national curriculum for school students.
attributes.background: Students across the country are being forced to do swimming even though they may be uncomfortable with swimming or struggle to do it. With the help of this petition, children will not be forced to something, which weekly, children are worrying about.

attributes.action: Rename HMS Prince Of Wales to HMS Ark Royal
attributes.background: We have had an HMS Ark Royal in the royal navy since 1587 the flagship of the English fleet during the spanish armada campaign its always been the flag ship of the royal navy so it is only right to rename Hms Prince of Wales to Hms Ark royal
attributes.additional_details: The british people want a new Hms Ark royal

attributes.action: Safeguard public funds with full annual NAO risk audit on all outsourcers
attributes.background: The Government should change the law so that the NAO is given responsibly for auditing any company that wins Government contract worth more than £20 million and that any appropriate contract must include an agreement to be audited by the NAO and the results made public.
attributes.additional_details: As illustrated by Carillion and numerous other major corporate failures before it, the ‘Big Four’ independent audit opinion has been confirmed as inherently flawed.  There is an inherent risk in the ‘Big Four’ conducting annual audits of companies where senior management are ex-‘Big Four’ themselves.  A mutual understanding serves each party in this situation as well as the knowledge that any moral hazard contracts or companies are ultimately backed by the government and UK taxpayers.

attributes.action: Debate diesel prices and car tax
attributes.background: Diesel prices: we were encouraged to buy a diesel car and now diesel prices and car tax are going up (and the roads are full of potholes). Electric cars are no good for towing and you have to sit about in services for a hour to recharge them.

attributes.action: Abolish prohibited lanes for HGV overtaking on M11 and A14.
attributes.background: These stretches of the M11 and A14 where overtaking for HGV’s is prohibited are completely counter productive. They serve to prevent HGV’s overtaking for long periods and inconveniencing other road users.
attributes.additional_details: In reality these lanes create long tailbacks as faster/unladen HGV’s have to queue behind other slower/laden vehicles uphill with reduced speeds of sometimes 25-30mph. When the restriction ends all the faster HGV’s accerlerate pull out into lane 2 to overtake. These lanes are a complete false economy and are dangerous.

attributes.action: Set out a date for the introduction of care home fees cap.
attributes.background: The Government has been making false promises to put a limit on care home fees since 2011. Last election, the Government promised in its lying manifesto to introduce a cap.
attributes.additional_details: People like me and my family that have worked hard bought our own homes and have been  "prudent with our money," have not been "rewarded" as the Government promised.

attributes.action: Stop Public Health England's recent 'Healthy Eating' initiatives.
attributes.background: PHE have launched several initiatives to make people more 'calorie-aware'. This includes Change4Life's 'look for 100-calorie snacks, two a day max' and the One You Campaign, which advises adults to follow a 400-600-600 diet. Calorie Counting leads to a fixation on numbers and disordered eating.
attributes.additional_details: Anorexia has the highest mortality rate of any psychiatric disorder, with at least 20% of Anorexia sufferers dying prematurely. (Source: BEAT Eating Disorders). Full recovery from this illness involves moving away from all preoccupation with food. Therefore, calorie counting is incompatible with recovery and may lead to a rise in eating disorders. Please support me to ensure more people are protected from this life-ruining condition.

attributes.action: Add 1p Income Tax & Reduce Aid to OECD average to create a BREXIT readiness fund
attributes.background: I believe the majority of British People support Foreign Aid spending but feel we are spending a bit too much currently. I also believe our Country is in need of Strategic Infrastructure and Business Support Spending to help us during the pre Brexit and immediate post Brexit period.

attributes.action: large vehicle awareness a mandatory part of obtaining a small vehicle licence
attributes.background: I feel that not enough people driving small vehicles are educated about the dangers of sharing the road with Heavy goods vehicles, Dangerous goods and long loads pose a threat to life if the proper information hasn't been given to all including those who are simply sharing the road.
attributes.additional_details: All I am asking is for people to be taught about what the signs mean on trucks that are designed to warn other road users of the dangers the vehicle poses. And for potential car licence holders to be educated on stopping times and blind spots of different vehicles. 75% of accidents between HGVs and cars are the car drivers fault and being given more awareness as part of a small vehicle licence could drastically improve those figures and even save lives!

attributes.action: Give free child care to all 2 year olds
attributes.background: Why should only parents on certain benefits receive childcare? For fairness, all 2 year olds should receive free childcare, regardless of background.

attributes.action: Allow IVF medication to be donated or sold through appropriate channels.
attributes.background: IVF medication is extremely expensive and is very often left over in large quantities due to miscalculation or like in my case because the treatment didn’t work. I have £800 worth of perfectly good medication (non-refrigerated) and my only option is, incredibly, to DISPOSE OF IT.
attributes.additional_details:
I contacted charities and IVF support groups and found that it’s actually illegal under the Medicines Act and the Drug trafficking Act to give them to someone else. 

IVF clinics or infertility charities should be allowed to redistribute the medication, helping families that cannot afford the drugs.

attributes.action: Ban large boats from passing through swing bridges at peak times.
attributes.background:
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic
3. Pollution - Every car passing the route will be sat in the same spot with the engine running for a good 20-30 minutes
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why boats shouldn't be allowed to pass through swing bridges at peak times;
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic. Dying? Tough - a boat needs to deliver a few boxes of car parts
3. Pollution - pretty much every car that is on its way home from work will be sat in the same spot with the engine running (unless it's stop start) for a good 20-30 minutes

attributes.action: Ban robotic trading of stocks, shares or financial derivatives
attributes.background: Robotic/algorithmic trading  of stocks, shares and financial derivatives are used by big corporates to steal money from retail investors.
attributes.additional_details: Big banks and institutions should not be allowed do use automatic trading which could cause flash crash in the markets eventually stealing money from weak hands of retail investors. Such trading should be banned. Markets would be less volatile and retail investors feel more secured to invest in such a situation.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to ride motorcycles with a higher engine size than 50cc.
attributes.background: 16 years old are in danger of being taken off their bikes due to them being restricted and other volumes of traffic going at a much higher rate of speed past them, therefore increasing the accidents including young riders. 125cc would possibly be a better replacement as safer in the long term.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment the law states that 16 year olds cannot ride any motorcycle with an engine size higher than 50cc, this can be very dangerous as many roads now have speed limits way higher than this not allowing you to keep up with traffic or get out of a situation very quickly, therefore increasing the accidents including motorcycles and young riders. 125cc is a more sensible speed which is more reliable for young riders out on the roads at 16. To make sure it is safe for a young driver an additional test could be added allowing you to progress up rather than just a CBT, this time including a small theory

attributes.action: Educate people on buying bikes, bike safety and bike security.
attributes.background: So many people go off to buy cheap bikes and they have faults very quickly.So they throw it away or repair and replace parts often, this can a have a negative impact on the environment and people will ride bikes less, increasing the negative impact on the environment.We should ride bikes a lot more.

attributes.action: Remove  the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: Extend paternity leave to at least 4 weeks so fathers can bond with their child.
attributes.background: Being a father and being there for your new born baby is so important at the early stages of life, to bond and make that connect this needs to happen early on in a baby's life, also helping your partner out with the night and day duties taking some of that pressure off the mother.
attributes.additional_details: How can men and women truly be treated equally if the father only get 1-2 week paternity leave and the mother gets up 26 weeks with full pay and 26 weeks additional weeks half pay depending on the company. This is such a serious matter and should be looked into carefully in the best interest of the baby and parents no matter the sex.

attributes.action: Make fire extinguishers mandatory in tower blocks
attributes.background: Many tower blocks don’t have the minimum safety in case a fire occurs and to prevent any further accident to spread, there should be a law forcing tower blocks to have fire extinguishers

attributes.action: Change the laws on buying and selling property in England and Wales
attributes.background: The government urgently need to review the laws relating to buying and selling property.Buying or selling a property is one of the most stressful experiences of any adults life.
attributes.additional_details: The current system is open to absolute abuse and gives neither the buyer or seller any security or confidence that the transaction will be completed.Should one part of the housing chain collapse, many individuals and families are caused massive distress,anxiety and financial loss.It isn't difficult to change the laws to those they follow in Scotland.This is the 21st century.The laws need to be changed now.As far as I can see the only reason changes haven't been made is because the lawyers don't want it changed.If the property sale falls through, they still get paid.

attributes.action: Re-introduce free milk in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: Free milk was a great way of making children that little bit happier about going to school, so now I believe we should reintroduce it back to schools

attributes.action: Stop the ban of menthol cigarettes when the UK leaves the EU
attributes.background: A cigarette is a cigarette menthol or not, it's just a preference as is coke with vodka. In 2020 menthol cigarettes were to be banned under new EU laws but the UK is preparing to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst on the topic binge drinking seems to be a regular thing and alcohol also takes/ruins many lives but I don't see any graphic images or warnings on alcohol. End the menthol and flavoured tobacco ban in 2020 since the UK is leaving the EU.

attributes.action: Make using red flashing lights on recovery trucks mandatory.
attributes.background: In 2018 alone we have had some very tragic incidents on the roads that could of been prevented. A lack of concentration whilst driving at speed is killing innocent workers. More needs to be done to protect workers roadside. Hitting a stationary vehicle on the hard shoulder shouldn't happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike blue flashing lights, amber lights grant no priority in traffic and are used to solely to emphasize a vehicle, often due to being a hazard. AKA non important
.Vehicles that use amber flashing lights include:

Road / highway maintenance vehicle 
Refuse collection vehicle
Breakdown recovery vehicle
the list goes on.

Most vehicles that do any kind of civil work have amber flashing lights, they are abused and misused, giving drivers the indication they are not important. This needs to change. All recovery trucks to have flashing reds fitted so motorist understand drivers need the room to operate. Workers to return home safe, not in a coffin.
